Machine Learning

Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that involves the use of algorithms and statistical models to enable machines to learn from data, make decisions, and improve their performance over time. The digital universe is generating vast amounts of data, with Google processing 24 peta bytes per day, Facebook uploading 10 million photos every hour, and YouTube uploading 1 hour of video every second. This data comes in different sizes and types, including texts, numbers, clickstreams, graphs, tables, images, transactions, and videos. The increasing value of the internet of things is creating a rich data landscape that offers numerous opportunities for businesses and individuals alike.

Key Concepts:

  • Feature extraction
  • Data types (text, numbers, clickstreams, graphs, tables, images, transactions, videos)
  • The Digital Universe of Opportunities
  • Data collection and preparation
  • Machine learning process
  • Privacy and data protection
Machine Learning Data Science Data Mining Data Analysis Statistical Learning Knowledge Discovery in Databases Pattern Discovery
